snippet: With Americans’ fears about a terrorist attack on the rise, a New York Times/CBS News poll finds the public is questioning President Obama’s strategy for combating the militant organization calling itself the Islamic State.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds the public is questioning Pres Obama’s strategy for combating Islamic State in Iraq and Syria extremists; two-thirds of Americans surveyed say the country is on the wrong track and half disapprove of how Obama is doing his job, negative assessment that threatens to be substantial drag on Democrats in November elections.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and DALIA SUSSMAN
byline.contributor: Marina Stefan and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With Americans’ fears about a terrorist attack on the rise, a New York Times/CBS News poll finds the public is questioning President Obama’s strategy for combating the militant organization calling itself the Islamic State.

headline.main: Obama Faulted in Terror Fight, New Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Obama Faulted in Terror Fight, New Poll Finds

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
